about: Text or controlled vocabulary/ontology, singly or as an array: The subject matter of this CreativeWork
abstract: Text: A descriptive summary of a CreativeWork
citation: Text: A textual citation to other work relevant to this CreativeWork
comment: Text: A textual comment on the CreativeWork

copyrightNotice: Text. Text of a notice appropriate for describing the copyright aspects of this Creative Work
correction: Text:  description of a correction to the CreativeWork
creditText: Text: Text used to credit person(s) and/or organization(s) associated with this CreativeWork
educationalLevel: Text: The level in terms of progression through an educational or training context. Examples of educational levels include 'beginner', 'intermediate' or 'advanced', and formal sets of level indicators.
educationalUse: Text:  Description of the purpose of this CreativeWork in the context of education
encodingFormat: Text: Textual description of the media type typically expressed using a MIME format (see IANA site [http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml] and MDN reference [https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/MIME_types]), e.g. application/zip for a SoftwareApplication binary, audio/mpeg for .mp3 etc.
inLanguage: Text: The language of the content or performance or used in an action.
keywords: Text: Keywords or tags used to describe the CreativeWork.
alternateName: Text: An alternative name for this Thing.
description: Text: Free text which describes this Thing.
identifier: Text - The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links. See background notes for more details.
name: Text: The name of the item.
url: URL to the WordPress page about this dataset
